title: Camping!
name: Camping!
description:
A Map by Rubberneck

Mostly places we've camped at, with a few vacation spots or activities thrown in.

properties.name: Carlsbad Caverns National Park
properties.description: Posted by Rubberneck    This karst landscape in the state of New Mexico comprises over 80 recognized caves. They are outstanding not only for their size but also for the profusion, diversity and beauty of their mineral formations. Lechuguilla Cave stands out from the others, providing an underground laboratory where geological and biological processes can be studied in a pristine setting.

properties.name: Fort Wilderness
properties.description: Posted by Rubberneck Hiya kids! We were here in Oct. 2006, and it was hot and humid. Lots of campers had Halloween decor up.

properties.name: Inks Lake State Park
properties.description: Posted by Rubberneck  A great state park in the Hill Country. We enjoyed the hiking. You can also rent canoes and go out to the Devil\'s Waterhole, where kids like to jump off the cliffs. Loads of deer.

properties.name: Lake Murray State Park
properties.description: Posted by Rubberneck  Nice lake. The location is very pretty, but the camping sites aren\'t great. We were here for Spring Break, 2006.

properties.name: Lake Whitney State Park
properties.description: Posted by Rubberneck

properties.name: LakeOuachita State Park
properties.description: Posted by Rubberneck  Lake Ouachita State ParkWe went camping here in the summer of 2003, I think. The picture was taken at our picnic table.

properties.name: Longhorn Cavern State Park
properties.description: Posted by Rubberneck  A river-formed cavern near Inks Lake. They have found evidence of Ice Age animals living in it. There is a great cave tour, but be prepared to get [i]very[/i] dirty. We went with the boy scouts on Labor Day weekend, 2005.

properties.name: Rusk-Palestine State Park
properties.description: Posted by Rubberneck  Rusk-Palestine State ParkA small, pretty state park next to the Texas State Railroad. This railroad runs from this state park to another one in Palestine. You can board a steam engine train and take the 1.5 hour ride for fun. Good for Thomas the Tank Engine fans.

properties.name: Turkey Roost, Cedar Ridge Park Belton Lake
properties.description: Posted by Rubberneck Turkey Roost Group Camp Area, Cedar Ridge ParkWe\'ve gone camping Memorial Day weekend here several years. Deer, turkey, nice lake.

properties.name: Tyler State Park
properties.description: Posted by Rubberneck 789 Park Road 16, Tyler, TX, 75706Camped here during Spring Break of 2002
